I was wondering... I am writing yet another paper on the Meiji 
Restoration for my grad class. These papers (4-6 pages) are usually to 
be written in 4 days, and are real killers, since there is technically 
no time to double and triple check one's sources. (we usually read 
3-400 pages per paper) I usually exchange them with some of my 
classmates the day before they're due, but rarely get a real input.

Well, since in this mailing list there are so many competent people, I 
was thinking that maybe somebody ***MIGHT*** want to read the final 
draft of my papers, and point out to eventual mistakes. More over, I 
suppose I am not the only student here, so it would be cool if others 
as well would exchange papers and we could help each other, while 
learning something new.

Well, my paper is due on Tuesday... let me know here or in private if 
you have the time and the will to check it... Or should I simply send 
it like a post, and the willing can criticize it. That would be... 
ouch... but... why not??
Thanks and ban-banzai.
cepo

PS = Professor Tony and other faculty on the list... This would be 
academically acceptable, right? I mean, I am not asking people to write 
my papers, just to give an opinion on them...
